content.description: Start sitting just left of the left arete of the overhanging face of the boulder with hands on rounded pebbles ~3' off the ground. Climb straight up using incuts and jugs to get up to the mini dihedral and from there continue on up to a flat top-out.
content.location: Just left of the front face of the Corkscrew, links into the same finish as Corkscrewing Around.

content.description: Similar to the other lines on this face. Grab starting holds at around chest height, the biggest pebbles you can find. Climb straight up to the crack in the middle of the wall using good incut holes where pebbles popped out. Continue on up a few feet to the top and an easy finish.
content.location: On the left face of the corkscrew boulder, this climb starts just to the left of the smaller tree.

content.description: Start with both hands in the crack all the way at the left base of the corkscrew boulder. With huge feet along the ledge, traverse along right and slightly up towards the overhanging face of the boulder. Top out just before the arete.
content.protection: Several pads or a pad & spotter combo.
content.location: Left side of the corkscrew boulder. This climb starts all the way left of the big tree on that left face. At the start of the crack that turns into the lip of the boulder as you traverse along it.

content.description:
This is the juggy route that goes up the right face of the big overhang.    The crux is some sharp crimps midway.  

  The top-out is good, with big , solid holds.
content.protection: at least two crash pads. Possibly a helmet for the spotter  in case of rock breakage until the climb has been done a few times.
content.location: Start as low as you can in the middle of the right face, go straight up.

content.description: Start standing under roof with both hands on obvious  ledge. Climb up and over roof using crimps and jugs. Arete jugs are off.
content.location: Starts on the big ledge on the right side of roof. just left of the arete.

content.description: Start standing under the left side of the roof. Climb up and over roof using slopers and jugs to a scary mantel.
Pull on to incut holds where pebbles used to be. Climb up to the middle crack using good incut dishes and jugs. From there continue straight on up to the top, good holds the whole way.
content.location: In the middle of the left face of the Corkscrew boulder. This climb starts directly to the right of the large tree next to the boulder.

content.description: A puddingstone conglomerate boulder located right near the 'main' entrance of the park.  This boulder has a tall overhanging front face with a few easier lines and around the left side of the boulder is a long ~13 tall face with several easy lines up and a good traverse. Not a bad warm-up boulder if you are looking o spend your session in Puddingstone Heights.
